page.title: 12Police and Crime in Shelford
page.content: In the Shelford Police force there are two plain clothed policemen and three detectives.There are also two uniformed policemen.Everyday one policeman patrols eleven villages.Two policemen work on an eight hour shift. The most common crimes in Shelford are assaults and theft.When the policemen are on patrol they carry no weapons.The more professional burglers operate during the day.Most fines in Shelford are accidents not arson.One case of arson was when a bus shelter was burnt down.The main age range for these crimes are eleven to seventeen.The area had a wave of glue sniffing.Therefore shops will not sell glue to the children,unless they have a note from their parents,or they are over eighteen.Alot of bikes go missing as well as cars.There is generally no vandalism.
